name: WebMDMedReminders
0:
”Alexa, open web m. d. med reminders”
”Add reminder”
”What time should I take ibuprofen?”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: web m. d. med reminders
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Never miss a dose with WebMD Med Reminders. You’ll receive reminders when it’s time to take your pills and medicine. Reminders also sync to the WebMD app on your smartphone when you sign-in with your WebMD account. 
 
INSTRUCTIONS 
 
SETUP: 
1. After enabling the skill in the Alexa app on your smartphone, sign-in/register with a WebMD account and grant Reminder permissions in the Skill Settings. If you have never created a WebMD account, tap “Sign Up” at the bottom of the sign-in screen and follow the instructions on the registration form. 
2. IMPORTANT: You must open the skill at least once on your Alexa-enabled device to start receiving your reminders. 

USE: 
- You can also view and mark your reminders in the WebMD app on your smartphone. 
- If you already have reminders created in the WebMD app and are signed-in to the app, your reminders will automatically sync to the WebMD Med Reminders Alexa skill. 
- A notification will sound on your Alexa-enabled device when you have a current reminder.
- When you have a current reminder, you can mark it as "Taken," "Skipped," or snooze it to be alerted again 15 minutes later. 
- IMPORTANT: If you create a new reminder on your smartphone, you must open the WebMD Med Reminders skill on your Alexa-enabled device to sync the new reminder.
 
COMMANDS: 
- Say “add reminder” to create a new med reminder 
- Say “next reminder” to hear about your upcoming schedule 
- Say “edit reminder” to adjust a reminder time or delete a reminder 
- Say “list” to hear about all of your reminders for the day
